Surge in influenza, sporadic cases of dengue in Coimbatore district - The Hindu
summary:
Surge in Influenza and Sporadic Cases of Dengue in Coimbatore District

Published on: December 20, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Hospitals in Coimbatore are witnessing a surge in influenza cases, affecting both children and adults, alongside sporadic cases of dengue. Health professionals emphasize the need for caution and hygiene.

  • Increase in influenza cases reported in Coimbatore district.
  • Dengue cases are sporadic, with mild symptoms appearing in most individuals.
  • Children are particularly vulnerable to respiratory infections, including RSV and HMPV.
  • Parents advised to monitor children for warning signs of dengue post-fever.
  • Public health measures like mask-wearing can mitigate risks.
“If children develop influenza, parents should not send them to school as the infection could spread to more children.” - Dr. K. Neminathan

The rise in these illnesses highlights ongoing public health concerns and the need for preventive measures to protect vulnerable populations.
newTitle: Surge in Influenza and Sporadic Cases of Dengue in Coimbatore District

Why Share Market Fell Today? Know Top Reasons For Stock Market Crash On December 20 - News18
summary:
Why Share Market Fell Today? Know Top Reasons For Stock Market Crash On December 20

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: News18

The Indian stock market witnessed a sharp decline today, with the BSE Sensex plummeting 1,176 points to close at 78,041.59, while the NSE Nifty dropped 364.20 points to end at 23,587.5.

  • IT stocks initially provided relief but soon succumbed to broader market pressure.
  • Significant declines in mid- and small-cap stocks, impacting investor sentiment.
  • The hawkish stance of the US Federal Reserve dampened market outlook.
  • Foreign institutional investors have turned aggressive sellers, offloading Rs 12,230 crore of Indian equities.
  • The Nifty's technical breach of key moving averages increased selling pressure.
“The sell-off has been widespread, with significant declines in mid- and small-cap stocks,” said Vinod Nair, head of research at Geojit Financial Services.

Investors are advised to adopt a cautious approach, focusing on quality large-cap stocks with reasonable valuations.
newTitle: Why Share Market Fell Today? Know Top Reasons For Stock Market Crash On December 20

title: UltraTech Cements receives green flag from CCI to acquire majority stake in India Cements | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
UltraTech Cements Receives Approval to Acquire Majority Stake in India Cements

Date: Friday, [Date not specified] Source: PTI

UltraTech Cement has received approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to acquire a majority stake in India Cements, expanding its presence in the southern cement market.

  • The CCI granted UltraTech a license to acquire up to 26% of India Cements' equity share capital.
  • UltraTech's proposed acquisition includes a 32.72% stake from the promoters of India Cements.
  • The approval was facilitated by J Sagar Associates, legal advisors to UltraTech.
  • This move is part of UltraTech's strategy to enhance its operations in Tamil Nadu, a rapidly growing market.
"Competition Commission of India (CCI) approves UltraTech Cement Ltd's acquisition of India Cements Ltd," the competition watchdog stated.

As of now, UltraTech leads the Indian cement market with a capacity of 156.66 million tonnes of grey cement per annum.
newTitle: UltraTech Cements Receives Approval to Acquire Majority Stake in India Cements

title: UltraTech Cements receives green flag from CCI to acquire majority stake in India Cements - Mint
Jaipur gas tanker crash: 11 killed, many critical; damaged LPG outlet nozzle triggered fire - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jaipur Gas Tanker Crash Claims 11 Lives, Causes Widespread Damage

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic gas tanker accident on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway resulted in the death of 11 individuals and left many others critically injured due to a subsequent fire that engulfed numerous vehicles.

  • The collision occurred at around 5:30 AM.
  • The damaged LPG outlet nozzle triggered a gas leak that caused the fire.
  • Fire spread rapidly, affecting about 37 vehicles and nearby buildings.
  • Eyewitnesses reported hearing multiple explosions and described a chaotic scene as people attempted to escape.
  • The state government has announced financial assistance for the victims' families.
“A total of 11 people have died. Five were brought dead to SMS hospital. Five succumbed during treatment.” - Dr. Deepak Maheshwari

The event has raised concerns over safety regulations regarding hazardous materials on public highways.
newTitle: Jaipur Gas Tanker Crash Claims 11 Lives, Causes Widespread Damage

All about Uganda 'Dinga Dinga' fever outbreak which makes patients 'shake like dancing' - CNBCTV18
summary:
All about Uganda 'Dinga Dinga' fever outbreak which makes patients 'shake like dancing'

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

In Uganda's Bundibugyo district, health authorities are investigating a mysterious disease known locally as 'Dinga Dinga,' which manifests as severe body shaking and fever. This outbreak predominantly affects women and girls, with more than 300 reported cases.

  • More than 300 cases of 'Dinga Dinga' fever have been reported, mainly among women and girls.
  • The disease is characterized by fever and uncontrollable body shaking that restricts movement.
  • Health officials are treating patients with antibiotics, although a confirmed diagnosis is still pending.
  • Symptoms include fever, headache, cough, runny nose, and body aches.
  • Health experts are investigating possible links to respiratory pathogens like influenza and COVID-19.
“It was very disturbing. I was taken to the Bundibugyo Hospital for treatment, and thank God, I am now fine.” - Affected Patient

The situation is under close observation as local health authorities urge residents to avoid relying on unverified herbal treatments and instead seek proper medical care.
newTitle: Understanding the 'Dinga Dinga' Fever Outbreak in Uganda

title: 'Pushing around MPs no sign of mardangi': Kiren Rijiju slams Rahul Gandhi over Parliament scuffle - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kiren Rijiju Criticizes Rahul Gandhi for Parliament Scuffle

Published on: December 20, 2024Source: Hindustan Times

Union minister Kiren Rijiju criticized Congress leader Rahul Gandhi following a scuffle between MPs outside the Parliament, stating that such behavior does not reflect masculinity and should be avoided. The incident resulted in injuries to two MPs and led to police involvement.

  • Rijiju condemned Rahul Gandhi for pushing MPs during a protest.
  • The scuffle occurred during competing protests over Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar.
  • Injuries from the incident led to hospitalization of two MPs.
  • There were cross-complaints filed by both BJP and Congress.
  • The Lok Sabha's productivity for the session was notably low at nearly 58%.
"It's unfortunate when an incident leads to injury and a police case... It was avoidable, the Leader of Opposition should not get into physical mode." - Kiren Rijiju

This incident has highlighted the ongoing tensions between the ruling NDA and opposition parties in Parliament, further complicating political interactions.
newTitle: Kiren Rijiju Criticizes Rahul Gandhi for Parliament Scuffle

Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 The Rule surpasses Stree 2, Jawan, Baahubali 2 to become biggest Hindi net grosser in just 15 days - Hindustan Times
summary:
Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 The Rule surpasses Stree 2, Jawan, Baahubali 2 to become biggest Hindi net grosser in just 15 days

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna's Pushpa 2 The Rule has achieved a remarkable milestone by becoming the biggest Hindi net grosser of all time, grossing ₹621 crore in just 15 days.

  • The film surpasses Baahubali 2, KGF Chapter 2, Stree 2, Jawan, Pathaan, and Animal in terms of Hindi box office gross.
  • In its second week, the total collection stands at ₹264.8 crore, with major contributions from the Hindi language.
  • Pushpa 2 is directed by Sukumar and is a sequel to the hit Pushpa The Rise.
“The film is now eyeing to surpass Baahubali 2 The Conclusion's worldwide collection to secure its place among India's highest-grossing films.”

Pushpa 2 continues to captivate audiences and set new records at the box office.
newTitle: Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 The Rule Becomes the Biggest Hindi Net Grosser

title: European markets slide; Novo Nordisk down 20% after obesity drug results - CNBC
summary:
European Markets Decline Amid U.S. Political Turmoil; Novo Nordisk Shares Drop 20%

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: CNBC

The European markets faced a decline on Friday as investors reacted to recent political instability in the U.S. and monetary policy updates from major economies. Notably, Novo Nordisk experienced a significant stock drop after disappointing trial results for its obesity drug.

Key Points

  • The Stoxx 600 index fell by 1.7% by early afternoon, with all major sectors in the red.
  • Political uncertainty in the U.S. arose from a failed spending bill that could lead to a government shutdown.
  • Novo Nordisk's stock dropped over 20% following disappointing trial results for CagriSema.
  • Volkswagen shares gained more than 2% amid positive negotiation news with striking workers.
  • China held interest rates steady, while the U.S. Fed cut its core interest rate by 25 basis points.
“The pan-European Stoxx 600 index was 1.7% lower by 1:46 p.m. London time, with every sector and all major bourses in negative territory.”

Despite the difficulties in the markets, there are sectors like Volkswagen showing resilience. The overall sentiment remains cautious as investors navigate through the uncertainties.
newTitle: European Markets Decline Amid U.S. Political Turmoil; Novo Nordisk Shares Drop 20%

title: 'Tear gas, rubber bullets won't work': Congress chief Kharge attacks PM Modi over anti-farmer policies - The Times of India
summary:
Tear gas, rubber bullets won't work: Congress chief Kharge attacks PM Modi over anti-farmer policies

Publication Date: N/A
Source: The Times of India

Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has strongly criticized Prime Minister Modi's policies regarding farmers, stating that oppressive measures like tear gas and rubber bullets are ineffective against peaceful protests.

  • Kharge emphasizes the need for dialogue rather than forceful suppression.
  • He calls for attention to the grievances of the farming community.
  • The Congress party positions itself as a defender of farmers' rights and interests.
"Tear gas and rubber bullets won't work against the voice of farmers."

This statement highlights the escalating tensions between the government and farmers, with calls for reform in agricultural policies.
newTitle: Congress Chief Kharge Criticizes PM Modi's Policies on Farmers
